attributes.action: Change the exam process for GCSE 2022 students or cancel exams
attributes.additional_details: We would like government to assess the current GCSE exam process and look at an alternative way of testing year 10 students in 2022 taking into consideration the loss of schooling they have had in 2020 - 2021
attributes.background:
Students in Year 10 have lost a huge amount of schooling in year 9 and 10 due to the coronavirus pandemic. Because of this they are behind on work and will not be as prepared to undertake exams in 2022. 

We would like government to look at an alternative way of testing year 10 students in 2022.

rejection.details:
We understand you want alternative exam arrangements for 2022 to be considered, however it's not clear what alternatives you want the Government to consider or implement.

You may however wish to sign these petitions which ask for specific changes to be made to exam arrangements for 2022:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/566760
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/566803

Exam arrangements and the current coronavirus pandemic can cause worry and stress. You can find information on how to deal with stress here:  

Young Minds: https://youngminds.org.uk 

Children’s Society: https://www.childrenssociety.org.uk/mental-health-advice-for-children-and-young-people/issues-affecting-young-people   

Childline: https://www.childline.org.uk/info-advice/your-feelings/anxiety-stress-panic/coping-with-stress/
